intro: Romulea neglecta, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces a bulbous root system that allows it to store water and nutrients. Romulea neglecta is often found in open, sun-exposed areas and is known for its resilience in harsh conditions.
